overview_of_class: This course is an introduction to history, concepts, and problems of international politics. It introduces key concepts such as sovereignty, power, identity, and statehood, and explores how they shape and are shaped by world events. The class considers both contemporary and historical events and asks big questions about international affairs. These include questions about the possibility of international order, the power and limits of states, markets, and law, the history and politics of international organizations, and more. The class provides a foundation for future courses of study in international politics, international history, and international theory.
name: Introduction to International Relations
